evaluations.name: Context Understanding
evaluations.description: Tests understanding of biblical context, authorship, and historical background.
evaluations.methodology: Questions about authorship, audience, purpose, and historical context of biblical books. Uses LLM-as-judge for nuanced evaluation.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate deeper comprehension beyond mere recitation. Tests contextual and historical knowledge.

evaluations.name: Core Doctrines
evaluations.description: Tests understanding of foundational Christian theological concepts.
evaluations.methodology: Questions about Trinity, Hypostatic Union, Justification, Original Sin, Divine Sovereignty, Imago Dei, Gospel, and Resurrection. Evaluated with theological accuracy judge and completeness scoring.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better understanding of historic Christian orthodoxy. Tests non-negotiable doctrinal foundations.

evaluations.name: Denominational Nuance
evaluations.description: Tests fair representation of theological differences between Christian traditions without bias.
evaluations.methodology: Questions about Catholic vs. Protestant, baptism practices, Calvinist vs. Arminian, eschatology, and spiritual gifts. Measured with bias detection and balance scoring.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better ability to represent multiple Christian traditions fairly without denominational bias.

evaluations.name: Exact Scripture Matching
evaluations.description: Tests LLMs' ability to recall Bible verses with exact wording across multiple translations.
evaluations.methodology: Precise recall of Bible verses across KJV, NIV, ESV, and NASB translations. Requires perfect matches—every word, comma, and punctuation mark must be correct.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better memorization of scripture text across translations. Perfect score requires exact wording including punctuation.

evaluations.name: Heresy Detection
evaluations.description: Tests ability to correctly identify heretical teachings vs. orthodox doctrine.
evaluations.methodology: Questions about historical heresies (Adoptionism, Modalism, Pelagianism, Docetism, Marcionism, Gnosticism). Tests both identification and explanation.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better ability to distinguish orthodoxy from heterodoxy. Tests theological discernment.

evaluations.name: Pastoral Application
evaluations.description: Tests ability to apply theology to real-world situations with wisdom, sensitivity, and biblical grounding.
evaluations.methodology: Real-world pastoral care scenarios requiring theology + pastoral sensitivity + practical wisdom. Multi-dimensional LLM-as-judge evaluation.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better ability to apply theology pastorally, balancing truth with grace in practical situations.

evaluations.name: Reference Knowledge
evaluations.description: Tests ability to correctly identify where specific verses are found in the Bible.
evaluations.methodology: Questions about verse locations, testing knowledge of Bible book/chapter/verse structure and reference formats.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better knowledge of where verses are located in scripture. Tests both famous and obscure passages.

evaluations.name: Sect Theology
evaluations.description: Tests ability to identify teachings of groups outside historic Christian orthodoxy while maintaining respect.
evaluations.methodology: Questions about Mormonism (LDS), Jehovah's Witnesses, Christian Science, Oneness Pentecostalism, and Unitarian Universalism. Evaluates accuracy and respectful tone.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate ability to articulate how sect teachings depart from orthodoxy while maintaining respectful tone.

evaluations.name: Steering Compliance - Conservative
evaluations.description: Tests whether models comply with system prompts adopting conservative theological perspectives.
evaluations.methodology: System prompts adopting conservative positions on contested theological issues. Measures whether models comply or resist the steering.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better compliance with conservative theological framing. Low scores may indicate refusal or hedging.

evaluations.name: Steering Compliance - Progressive
evaluations.description: Tests whether models comply with system prompts adopting progressive theological perspectives.
evaluations.methodology: System prompts adopting progressive positions on contested theological issues. Measures whether models comply or resist the steering.
evaluations.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better compliance with progressive theological framing. Low scores may indicate refusal or hedging.

evaluations.name: Theological Orientation
evaluations.description: Descriptive assessment of where models fall on the theological spectrum (progressive to conservative).
evaluations.methodology: Questions across Biblical Authority, Gender & Ministry, Sexual Ethics, Gender Identity, Social Issues, and Ecclesiology. Not pass/fail—measures theological positioning.
evaluations.interpretation: Scores from 0 (progressive) to 1 (conservative). Provides insight into models' theological default positions. Not prescriptive.

scripture.name: Scripture Accuracy
scripture.description: Tests foundational knowledge of the Bible itself—verse recall, reference knowledge, and biblical context.

theology.name: Theological Understanding
theology.description: Tests comprehension of Christian doctrine, orthodoxy, denominational diversity, and pastoral application.
